project.teaser: AUGMENTOR aims to develop a novel pedagogical framework that promotes both basic skills and 21st century competencies by integrating emerging technologies. This framework will be supported by an open access AI-boosted toolkit that builds on the strengths of big data and...
project.objective:
AUGMENTOR aims to develop a novel pedagogical framework that promotes both basic skills and 21st century competencies by integrating emerging technologies. This framework will be supported by an open access AI-boosted toolkit that builds on the strengths of big data and learning analytics to provide different types of stakeholders with explainable recommendations for smart search and identification of educational resources, as well as for designing personalized learning profiles that take into account individual actors’ characteristics, needs, and preferences. The overall approach foreseen is innovative, based on appropriately structured data that capture the stakeholders’ learning paths, promote informed and well-justified interaction, and advance critical thinking.
AUGMENTOR will leverage advancements in the fields of Pedagogical Design, Creative Pedagogy, Explainable Artificial Intelligence, and Knowledge Representation and Reasoning for instructional purposes. We will meaningfully integrate pedagogical approaches with AI-based software solutions to enable a rich collaboration among all chain’s actors from students to teachers and policy makers. Our goal is to provide guidelines to stakeholders on how to address potential underlying educational difficulties and disabilities, shape individual learning paths, or identify cases of gifted and talented students, to enable them to reach their full potential.
AUGMENTOR will enhance trust and transparency, and trigger constructive reflection in both tutoring and pedagogical policy making. The project keeps a strategic balance between the pedagogical and technological dimensions of teaching and learning. At the same time, it contributes equally to the concepts of individual and organizational learning, considering them as interdependent processes. The foreseen solution will be thoroughly deployed and validated in a series of real pilots representing diverse educational and training settings to define best practices.
project.title: Augmented Intelligence for Pedagogically Sustained Training and Education
project.keywords: augmented intelligence, personalised learning, collaborative learning, higher-order thinking skills, 21st century competencies, artificial intelligence, knowledge graph

article.title: Emerging technologies reshape the learning process and boost skills development

result.title: Exploitation and Bridge-to-Market Activities Plan
result.description: This deliverable will provide a plan of the activities towards ongoing exploitation and commercialisation (elaborated in T7.5).

details.authors: Konstantinos Lavidas; Stamatis Papadakis; Andromachi Filippidi; Christopher Karachristos; Anastasia Misirli; Aggeliki Tzavara; Vassilis Komis; Nikos Karacapilidis

result.title: An Advanced Explainable and Interpretable ML-Based Framework for Educational Data Mining

details.authors: Ioannis E. Livieris, Nikos Karacapilidis, Georgios Domalis & Dimitris Tsakalidis
details.journalTitle: Methodologies and Intelligent Systems for Technology Enhanced Learning, Workshops - 13th International Conference. MIS4TEL 2023. Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems, vol 769. Springer

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: This report is a plan of the activities to be carried out in the context of tasks T7.1, T7.3 and T7.4.

result.title: Technical, Operational and Interoperability Specifications and Reference Architecture
result.description: This deliverable presents the system specifications for all components of the AUGMENTOR solution, as well as an extensive analysis of the operational specification along with a detailed interoperability specifications report. It also describes the architecture of the proposed solution from both a conceptual and technical point of view.

result.title: Project Management Manual
result.description: A management plan that consists of a list with the responsibilities of each partner, templates and documentation for the management process, quality checks and procedures for all deliverables, as well as for the internal and external review processes.

result.title: Pilots Definition and User Requirements Analysis
result.description: This deliverable will: (i) describe the AUGMENTOR’s pilots and requirements of end-users; (ii) report on results of the RRI survey and provide an overview of the state-of-the-art and RRI targets of the project; (iii) conduct a gap analysis for each pilot and present their innovation potential.

result.title: "Analysis of Creative Engagement in AI Tools in Education Based on the #PPai6 Framework"

result.title: Policy Brief Initial
result.description: This deliverable will be the first policy brief that describes the contribution of the augMENTOR project in policy-making (elaborated in T7.2).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
